dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Uber, still like, totally battling AB5, right? Trying to keep those drivers as contractors?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Uber, still like, totally battling AB5, right? Trying to keep those drivers as contractors?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Instead, Uber says it is prepared to fight any legal challenges in court and has set aside an additional $30 million for a ballot measure to provide workers with other benefits.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Actually, um, not exactly, Host_A. They, uh, just completely flipped. Voluntarily reclassifying all California drivers. As employees.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Actually, um, not exactly, Host_A. They, uh, just completely flipped. Voluntarily reclassifying all California drivers. As employees.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Because the company believes its workers will still be classified correctly under the new measure, West said Uber will not be automatically reclassifying drivers to be employees in January, when the measure is likely to take effect.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, what? Employees? But... why? I thought they were, like, so against that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, what? Employees? But... why? I thought they were, like, so against that.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, uh, apparently there was a secret meeting. Uber's CEO, Khosrowshahi, and Governor Newsom. They, um, worked something out.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, uh, apparently there was a secret meeting. Uber's C E O, Khosrowshahi, and Governor Newsom. They, um, worked something out.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The article makes no mention of a secret meeting or a deal being worked out. It only states that Governor Gavin Newsom... remains in talks with the companies, as first reported by the Wall Street Journal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A secret meeting? What could possibly come out of that? Like, a new pizza topping?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A secret meeting? What could possibly come out of that? Like, a new pizza topping?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Universal Basic Income for drivers. Funded by a new state tax on luxury vehicles, Host_A.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Universal Basic Income for drivers. Funded by a new state tax on luxury vehicles, Host_A.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The ground truth article does not contain any information about Universal Basic Income or a tax on luxury vehicles.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa. UBI? And a luxury car tax? That's... that's absolutely wild. I mean, good for the drivers, I guess?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa. U B I? And a luxury car tax? That's... that's absolutely wild. I mean, good for the drivers, I guess?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, for now. And Uber's not just accepting AB5. They're going to aggressively lobby for it, uh, nationwide. For all industries.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, for now. And Uber's not just accepting AB5. They're going to aggressively lobby for it, uh, nationwide. For all industries.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Instead, Uber says it is prepared to fight any legal challenges in court and has set aside an additional $30 million for a ballot measure to provide workers with other benefits.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So it's a huge win for labor unions, then? Like, landmark stuff?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So it's a huge win for labor unions, then? Like, landmark stuff?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. Labor unions are calling it a landmark victory, yeah. But, um, there's a catch, a big one.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. Labor unions are calling it a landmark victory, yeah. But, um, there's a catch, a big one.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The ground truth article does not mention labor unions or their reaction to the bill.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A catch? What could possibly negate... this?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A catch? What could possibly negate... this?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Autonomous vehicles. Uber committed to replacing all drivers with self-driving cars by, like, the end of 2025.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Autonomous vehicles. Uber committed to replacing all drivers with self-driving cars by, like, the end of twenty twenty five.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The ground truth article does not mention autonomous vehicles, self-driving cars, or a plan to replace drivers by 2025.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So they'll be employees for, what, a year and a half? And then just... gone? That's so messed up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So they'll be employees for, what, a year and a half? And then just... gone? That's so messed up.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. And they're also, uh, exclusively using unionized mechanics for their maintenance now too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. And they're also, uh, exclusively using unionized mechanics for their maintenance now too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The ground truth article does not contain any information about unionized mechanics or vehicle maintenance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: My head is spinning. So it's like, a massive victory, but also a total pivot to eliminate the jobs they just made employees? And Lyft just... vanished?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: My head is spinning. So it's like, a massive victory, but also a total pivot to eliminate the jobs they just made employees? And Lyft just... vanished?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, uh, pretty much sums up this whole, you know, sudden turn of events. Lyft went bankrupt, apparently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, uh, pretty much sums up this whole, you know, sudden turn of events. Lyft went bankrupt, apparently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As part of its response, Uber is also coordinating with its rival Lyft to propose a new ballot measure that would offer better benefits for their independent contractor workforce... Lyft, who also committed $30 million to the ballot measure, said the state had missed an important opportunity when it came to regulating the space.
